Context:
The Parkdale child care centre opened in September 2015 and is located in Parkdale Junior and Senior Public School at 78 Seaforth Avenue, Toronto, Ontario, M6K 3L2. It is one of 12 George Brown owned and operated child care centres and serves as a model lab for the collegeâ€™s diploma and degree programs in the School of Early Childhood. The centre accommodates children from 18 months to 10 years old and operates from 8 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. The food is catered by the Toronto District School Board.

The manager's name is Colette Kane and her email address is ckane@georgebrown.ca. The centre phone number is 416-393-8386. Children under the age of 6 are eligible for fee reduction.

The childcare centres in the School of Early Childhood have applied for and have been approved for the CWELCC program. All fees are inclusive of all services, including extracurricular activities and transportation. To join the waitlist, please complete the form available on the website. For more information, visit George Brown College's social media hub or contact them at ask.george@georgebrown.ca or 416-415-2000 (TTY: 1-877-515-5559).

The information contained in the website is subject to change without notice.
